comments:
Trying to create the file #virtual# will display no error and leave the New File dialog open.  Creating other files of the form #something# seems to work.  It just doesn't work on #virtual#.

Steps to Reproduce:
Find a folder and bring up the New File Dialog.
Type in the name #virtual#
Click Finish.
The dialog displays no error and the dialog stays open.

------------------------------------------------

I think I'd like to defer this to the future for now.

Unless Kushal or DaveM think we should address the underlying issue, that #virtual# is perhaps not the best separator for virtual files since it includes characters that are valid file names.

The problem is, that on UNIX almost all characters can be used in file names so it's hard to come up with a separator that cannot possibly be part of a file name.

What if we'd use the line feed character, which is perhaps the most unlikely (though not impossible) character to have embedded in a file name? E.g.
VIRTUAL_SEPARATOR="\nvirtual\n"? Would that a change that's somehow reflected in any mementos, state locations or otherwise cause any trouble if we changed it in the future? Or is it internal to RSE only? What about the dstore server and protocol?
